TI_DOC.P: FR-Paris: Indkøb af projektering af teknisk dokumentation i forbindelse med anlæggelse af multi-lejlighedsbygninger

TXT_MARK.P: RHP-W7-AB/IOP1-2017
Joint Regional Programme on Durable Solutions for Refugees and Displaced Persons – RHP/ Country Housing Programme in the Republic of Serbia

Framework Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 25.10.2013 and Grant Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to implementation of Subproject VII of the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 2.10.2015.
Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd
22-26 Nemanjina, 11000 Belgrade, Republic of Serbia

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Web address of the Contracting Authority:

TXT_MARK.P: www.piu.rs
International open procedure
Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Number of lots, if contract is divided in lots:

TXT_MARK.P: Not divided into lots.
299 000 EUR net of VAT

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Duration and type of framework contract (single supplier or multi-supplier framework contract) if framework contract is to be awarded:

TXT_MARK.P: Not applicable

All interested persons shall have the right to participate either individually or as a part of a group of tenderers, provided they fulfill eligibility criteria defined in a part of Tender Dossier: Instructions for Tenderers, Chapter 3: Eligibility criteria for evaluation and comparison, as well as conditions defined in the Procurement Manual for goods, works and services of the Council of Europe Development Bank, Chapter 3.3: Eligibility criteria for participation in the procedure and provision of goods, works and services.
http://www.coebank.org/en/about/policies-and-guidelines/projects-and-loans-policies-and-guidelines
Tenderers shall fulfill all the conditions listed below. In case of group tender, these selection criteria shall apply to the entire group of tendered.
1) Financial capacity of tenderers:
(a) Liquidity: Tenderer's account has not been blocked in the period of twelve (12) months before the Public Call for submission of tenders.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(b) Bankruptcy and liquidation: Tendered had not been subject to bankruptcy or liquidation procedure, or to previous bankruptcy procedure.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(c) Business revenues: Tenderer must have average annual operating income in the period of past three (3) years (2014, 2015, 2016) in the amount not less than 450 000,00 EUR net of VAT.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition.
(d) Indemnity insurance policy: Have a valid indemnity insurance policy at a minimum insured amount of 50 000 EUR.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium.
2) Human resource capacity of tenderers:

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Award criteria is most economically advantageous tender:

TXT_MARK.P: Criteria for economically most advantageous tender shall be based on the following elements:
No.: 1
Criteria elements: Key expert (01): Main Responsible Designer
Maximal score: 20 points
No.: 2
Criteria elements: Key experts (02-05): Lead Responsible Designers
Maximal score: 20 points
No.: 3
Criteria elements: Offered price
Maximal score: 60 points
No.:
Criteria elements: Total
Maximal score: 100 points

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Access to tender documents, internet address where tender documents can be downloaded:

TXT_MARK.P: http://www.piu.rs
http://portal.ujn.gov.rs

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Address and web page of state, regional and local authority where information about taxes, environmental protection, employment and working conditions can be found:
Submission of tenders, deadline for submission of tenders:

TXT_MARK.P: Tenders should be submitted as registered letter with return note. In case of personal submission, receipt of the tender will be issued by contracting authority.
Tender shall be submitted to the following address: Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, fifth floor – register’s office, 11000, Belgrade, Serbia.

If the tender is submitted in person, the delivery address is: Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, fifth floor – register’s office, 11000, Belgrade, Serbia, between 09:00h and 15:30h.
Final deadline for the submission of tenders shall be: 7.5.2018 by 12:00 pm (by local time).

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Tender opening session – date, time and venue

TXT_MARK.P: Opening of tenders shall be scheduled for 7.5.2018 at 12:30 pm (by local time), in the premises of Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, 11000, Belgrade.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Conditions for participation in tender opening session:

TXT_MARK.P: Contracting authority shall open the tenders in presence of authorised tenderers' representatives who wish to attend the opening session, in time and at the place designated in the Public Call and in the Instructions for Tenderers. Representatives of tenderers attending the opening session shall provide relevant authorisation for presence and signing, and shall sign a document to confirm their presence.
Not later than 120 days after the deadline for submitting tenders
Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo
Beograd
Procurement Division
milos.dabetic@piu.rs

All interested persons shall have the right to participate either individually or as a part of a group of tenderers, provided they fulfill eligibility criteria defined in a part of Tender Dossier: Instructions for Tenderers, Chapter 3: Eligibility criteria for evaluation and comparison, as well as conditions defined in the Procurement Manual for goods, works and services of the Council of Europe Development Bank, Chapter 3.3: Eligibility criteria for participation in the procedure and provision of goods, works and services.
http://www.coebank.org/en/about/policies-and-guidelines/projects-and-loans-policies-and-guidelines
Tenderers shall fulfill all the conditions listed below. In case of group tender, these selection criteria shall apply to the entire group of tendered.
1) Financial capacity of tenderers:
(a) Liquidity: Tenderer's account has not been blocked in the period of twelve (12) months before the Public Call for submission of tenders.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(b) Bankruptcy and liquidation: Tendered had not been subject to bankruptcy or liquidation procedure, or to previous bankruptcy procedure.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(c) Business revenues: Tenderer must have average annual operating income in the period of past three (3) years (2014, 2015, 2016) in the amount not less than 450 000,00 EUR net of VAT.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition.
(d) Indemnity insurance policy: Have a valid indemnity insurance policy at a minimum insured amount of 50 000 EUR.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium.
2) Human resource capacity of tenderers:

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Award criteria is most economically advantageous tender:

TXT_MARK.P: Criteria for economically most advantageous tender shall be based on the following elements:
No.: 1
Criteria elements: Key expert (01): Main Responsible Designer

No.: 2
Criteria elements: Key experts (02-05): Lead Responsible Designers
Maximal score: 20 points
No.: 3

If the tender is submitted in person, the delivery address is: Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, fifth floor – register’s office, 11000, Belgrade, Serbia, between 09:00h and 15:30h.
Final deadline for the submission of tenders shall be: 7.5.2018 by 12:00 pm (by local time).

TXT_MARK.P: Opening of tenders shall be scheduled for 7.5.2018 at 12:30 pm (by local time), in the premises of Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, 11000, Belgrade.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Conditions for participation in tender opening session:

TXT_MARK.P: Contracting authority shall open the tenders in presence of authorised tenderers' representatives who wish to attend the opening session, in time and at the place designated in the Public Call and in the Instructions for Tenderers. Representatives of tenderers attending the opening session shall provide relevant authorisation for presence and signing, and shall sign a document to confirm their presence.
Not later than 120 days after the deadline for submitting tenders

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Web address of the Contracting Authority:

TXT_MARK.P: www.piu.rs
International open procedure
Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.

TXT_MARK.P: www.piu.rs
International open procedure
Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.

TXT_MARK.P: Not divided into lots.
299 000 EUR net of VAT

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Duration and type of framework contract (single supplier or multi-supplier framework contract) if framework contract is to be awarded:

TXT_MARK.P: Not applicable

All interested persons shall have the right to participate either individually or as a part of a group of tenderers, provided they fulfill eligibility criteria defined in a part of Tender Dossier: Instructions for Tenderers, Chapter 3: Eligibility criteria for evaluation and comparison, as well as conditions defined in the Procurement Manual for goods, works and services of the Council of Europe Development Bank, Chapter 3.3: Eligibility criteria for participation in the procedure and provision of goods, works and services.
http://www.coebank.org/en/about/policies-and-guidelines/projects-and-loans-policies-and-guidelines
Tenderers shall fulfill all the conditions listed below. In case of group tender, these selection criteria shall apply to the entire group of tendered.
1) Financial capacity of tenderers:
(a) Liquidity: Tenderer's account has not been blocked in the period of twelve (12) months before the Public Call for submission of tenders.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(b) Bankruptcy and liquidation: Tendered had not been subject to bankruptcy or liquidation procedure, or to previous bankruptcy procedure.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(c) Business revenues: Tenderer must have average annual operating income in the period of past three (3) years (2014, 2015, 2016) in the amount not less than 450 000,00 EUR net of VAT.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition.
(d) Indemnity insurance policy: Have a valid indemnity insurance policy at a minimum insured amount of 50 000 EUR.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium.
2) Human resource capacity of tenderers:

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.

Framework Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 25.10.2013 and Grant Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to implementation of Subproject VII of the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 2.10.2015.
Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd
22-26 Nemanjina, 11000 Belgrade, Republic of Serbia

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Web address of the Contracting Authority:

TXT_MARK.P: www.piu.rs
International open procedure
Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Number of lots, if contract is divided in lots:

TXT_MARK.P: Not divided into lots.
299 000 EUR net of VAT

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Duration and type of framework contract (single supplier or multi-supplier framework contract) if framework contract is to be awarded:

TXT_MARK.P: Not applicable

All interested persons shall have the right to participate either individually or as a part of a group of tenderers, provided they fulfill eligibility criteria defined in a part of Tender Dossier: Instructions for Tenderers, Chapter 3: Eligibility criteria for evaluation and comparison, as well as conditions defined in the Procurement Manual for goods, works and services of the Council of Europe Development Bank, Chapter 3.3: Eligibility criteria for participation in the procedure and provision of goods, works and services.
http://www.coebank.org/en/about/policies-and-guidelines/projects-and-loans-policies-and-guidelines
Tenderers shall fulfill all the conditions listed below. In case of group tender, these selection criteria shall apply to the entire group of tendered.
1) Financial capacity of tenderers:
(a) Liquidity: Tenderer's account has not been blocked in the period of twelve (12) months before the Public Call for submission of tenders.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(b) Bankruptcy and liquidation: Tendered had not been subject to bankruptcy or liquidation procedure, or to previous bankruptcy procedure.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(c) Business revenues: Tenderer must have average annual operating income in the period of past three (3) years (2014, 2015, 2016) in the amount not less than 450 000,00 EUR net of VAT.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition.
(d) Indemnity insurance policy: Have a valid indemnity insurance policy at a minimum insured amount of 50 000 EUR.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium.
2) Human resource capacity of tenderers:

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Award criteria is most economically advantageous tender:

TXT_MARK.P: Criteria for economically most advantageous tender shall be based on the following elements:
No.: 1
Criteria elements: Key expert (01): Main Responsible Designer
Maximal score: 20 points
No.: 2
Criteria elements: Key experts (02-05): Lead Responsible Designers
Maximal score: 20 points
No.: 3
Criteria elements: Offered price
Maximal score: 60 points
No.:
Criteria elements: Total
Maximal score: 100 points

http://portal.ujn.gov.rs

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Address and web page of state, regional and local authority where information about taxes, environmental protection, employment and working conditions can be found:
Submission of tenders, deadline for submission of tenders:

TXT_MARK.P: Tenders should be submitted as registered letter with return note. In case of personal submission, receipt of the tender will be issued by contracting authority.
Tender shall be submitted to the following address: Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, fifth floor – register’s office, 11000, Belgrade, Serbia.

If the tender is submitted in person, the delivery address is: Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, fifth floor – register’s office, 11000, Belgrade, Serbia, between 09:00h and 15:30h.
Final deadline for the submission of tenders shall be: 7.5.2018 by 12:00 pm (by local time).

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Tender opening session – date, time and venue

TXT_MARK.P: Opening of tenders shall be scheduled for 7.5.2018 at 12:30 pm (by local time), in the premises of Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd, Veljka Dugoševića 54, 11000, Belgrade.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Conditions for participation in tender opening session:

TXT_MARK.P: Contracting authority shall open the tenders in presence of authorised tenderers' representatives who wish to attend the opening session, in time and at the place designated in the Public Call and in the Instructions for Tenderers. Representatives of tenderers attending the opening session shall provide relevant authorisation for presence and signing, and shall sign a document to confirm their presence.
Not later than 120 days after the deadline for submitting tenders
Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo
Beograd
Procurement Division

Framework Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 25.10.2013 and Grant Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to implementation of Subproject VII of the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 2.10.2015.
Jedinica za upravljanje projektima u javnom sektoru doo Beograd
22-26 Nemanjina, 11000 Belgrade, Republic of Serbia

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Web address of the Contracting Authority:

TXT_MARK.P: www.piu.rs
International open procedure
Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Number of lots, if contract is divided in lots:

TXT_MARK.P: Not divided into lots.
299 000 EUR net of VAT

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Duration and type of framework contract (single supplier or multi-supplier framework contract) if framework contract is to be awarded:

TXT_MARK.P: Not applicable

All interested persons shall have the right to participate either individually or as a part of a group of tenderers, provided they fulfill eligibility criteria defined in a part of Tender Dossier: Instructions for Tenderers, Chapter 3: Eligibility criteria for evaluation and comparison, as well as conditions defined in the Procurement Manual for goods, works and services of the Council of Europe Development Bank, Chapter 3.3: Eligibility criteria for participation in the procedure and provision of goods, works and services.
http://www.coebank.org/en/about/policies-and-guidelines/projects-and-loans-policies-and-guidelines
Tenderers shall fulfill all the conditions listed below. In case of group tender, these selection criteria shall apply to the entire group of tendered.
1) Financial capacity of tenderers:
(a) Liquidity: Tenderer's account has not been blocked in the period of twelve (12) months before the Public Call for submission of tenders.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(b) Bankruptcy and liquidation: Tendered had not been subject to bankruptcy or liquidation procedure, or to previous bankruptcy procedure.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(c) Business revenues: Tenderer must have average annual operating income in the period of past three (3) years (2014, 2015, 2016) in the amount not less than 450 000,00 EUR net of VAT.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition.
(d) Indemnity insurance policy: Have a valid indemnity insurance policy at a minimum insured amount of 50 000 EUR.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium.
2) Human resource capacity of tenderers:

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

All interested persons shall have the right to participate either individually or as a part of a group of tenderers, provided they fulfill eligibility criteria defined in a part of Tender Dossier: Instructions for Tenderers, Chapter 3: Eligibility criteria for evaluation and comparison, as well as conditions defined in the Procurement Manual for goods, works and services of the Council of Europe Development Bank, Chapter 3.3: Eligibility criteria for participation in the procedure and provision of goods, works and services.
http://www.coebank.org/en/about/policies-and-guidelines/projects-and-loans-policies-and-guidelines
Tenderers shall fulfill all the conditions listed below. In case of group tender, these selection criteria shall apply to the entire group of tendered.
1) Financial capacity of tenderers:
(a) Liquidity: Tenderer's account has not been blocked in the period of twelve (12) months before the Public Call for submission of tenders.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(b) Bankruptcy and liquidation: Tendered had not been subject to bankruptcy or liquidation procedure, or to previous bankruptcy procedure.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium and all subcontractors.
(c) Business revenues: Tenderer must have average annual operating income in the period of past three (3) years (2014, 2015, 2016) in the amount not less than 450 000,00 EUR net of VAT.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition.
(d) Indemnity insurance policy: Have a valid indemnity insurance policy at a minimum insured amount of 50 000 EUR.
In case of consortium: This provision applies to all members of the consortium.
2) Human resource capacity of tenderers:

(a) The Tender, in the month preceding the opening date of the Tenders, employs (on employment contract) has at least 32 persons, of which at least 24 persons must be graduated engineers from some of the following professions:
— Graduated Architecture Engineer,
— Graduated Civil Engineer,
— Graduated Electrical Engineer,
— Graduated Mechanical Engineer.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium shall fulfil at least 50 % of the listed condition, while it must have at least one engineer employed for each required area.
3) Technical capacity of tenderers:
(a) Prior experience in the development of technical documentation:

In the period from 1.1.2013 until the tender opening session, the tenderer has developed or has been leading member of a consortium performing development of complete technical documentation which includes, preliminary design, design for construction permit and design for construction (or following the terminology from previous legislation), with all installations, for the construction of new buildings, upgrade or reconstruction of the existing buildings, in particular:

Residential buildings (residential buildings with two or more apartments, building for communities), non-residential buildings (hotels and other buildings for shortterm stay), of minimum 40 000 m2 total gross area, out of which minimum six buildings should be larger than 3 000 m2 total gross area.

Current development of technical documentation and prior experience in the course of which there were breaches and contract terminations by contracting authority, shall not be taken into account as relevant reference.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(b) Tenderer shall hold at least the 24 authorised licenses for 2D/3D drawing software (CAD programs) enabling creation of documentation in DWG 2013 format or later DWG format.
Group of tenderers: Leading member of the consortium must fulfil at least 50 % of the listed conditions.
(c) Tenderer must hold valid certificate for ISO 9001:2015 (2008), scope: Design Development.
Group of tenderers: At least 1 member of the consortium must fulfill listed condition.

Framework Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 25.10.2013 and Grant Agreement entered into between the Council of Europe Development Bank and the Republic of Serbia in relation to implementation of Subproject VII of the Regional Housing Programme, signed on 2.10.2015.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Web address of the Contracting Authority:

TXT_MARK.P: www.piu.rs
International open procedure
Service contract
Provision of services for design of technical documentation for the construction of multiapartment buildings CPV code: 71220000.

In the agreement on implementation of CHP in the Republic of Serbia, construction of multi-apartment buildings has been stipulated as one of modalities (A1: Apartment buildings) to be implemented through several implementation phases.
The aforesaid housing modality has been defined as collective housing mode in buildings and new locations, and it pertains to refugees who want to integrate in local communities as beneficiaries.

The scope of this project implies drafting of documentation for apartment buildings located in the following towns and cities: Vrnjačka Banja, Aranđelovac, Loznica, Arilje, Subotica, Vršac, Pančevo, Bački Petrovac i Novi Sad.
